business.headline: Will ITR filing deadline be extended again? Here's why it mightIn May, the CBDT announced extending the ITR filing deadline, citing big changes in the forms and system readiness. It said that the updated ITRs will make compliance simpler and reporting more transparent for taxpayers.

Zepto, Blinkit, Instamart face a new rival in Delhi's 10-min delivery warThe move brings the e-commerce giant into direct competition with local players such as Blinkit (owned by Eternal), Swiggy Instamart and Zepto, who already dominate the quick delivery space.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe?The bidding window for the IPO will remain open until Monday, July 14. Investors can place bids within the price band of Rs 387 to Rs 407 per share.

When nursery fees need an EMI: CoinSwitch co-founder flags new middle-class crisisOnce believed to be the key to a better life, schooling today has ironically become the heaviest expense for India's middle-class families, who are struggling to keep up, says Ashish Singhal, co-founder of CoinSwitch.

Nvidia now worth nearly as much as India's economy. Details hereAccording to the International Monetary Fund (IMF), India's gross domestic product is currently estimated at $4.2 trillion and is expected to touch $4.27 trillion by the end of 2025.

3 key reasons behind Bitcoin's record high todayAt the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $111,019.74, rising by 2.27% over the past day. The last record was set on May 22 when it briefly touched $111,970. Since then, Bitcoin has had a bumpy ride, but it seems to be back with a bang.

TCS to announce Q1 results today: Here's what to expect from the IT giantTCS Q1 results: Apart from growth numbers, the market will also watch for any announcements on interim dividends, updates on client budgets in sectors like banking, retail, and manufacturing, and comments on the pace of new deal wins.
Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

Travel Food Services allotment: Step-by-step to check allotment statusInvestors can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to hit $4 trillion in market valueNvidia's market cap now exceeds the combined value of the Canadian and Mexican stock markets. It is also larger than the total market capitalisation of all publicly listed companies in the UK, according to LSEG data.

Emirates signs deal to accept crypto payments for flight bookings: ReportIn recent years, the UAE has grown into a popular place for crypto companies. Many crypto firms have opened offices there or are planning to expand. Today, people in the UAE can already use cryptocurrencies to pay for things like real estate, school fees and even transport services.

This 20-year-old Tamil composer signs 8 films even before debut releaseA 20-year-old Tamil composer, who kicked off his career as an independent musician, will now compose for eight big Tamils in the South. Among the eight films is Allu Arjun's mega-budget film with director Atlee.

Rashmika Mandanna, Janhvi Kapoor, Mrunal Thakur in Allu Arjun-Atlee's mega AA22xA6Rashmika Mandanna has joined Atlee's giant project featuring Allu Arjun, tentatively titled 'AA22xA6'. The film also features more popular female names, including Deepika Padukone, Janhvi Kapoor and Mrunal Thakur.

Priyanka Chopra chooses hot dog over vada pav, leaves desi fans dividedPriyanka Chopra's recent interview sparked mixed reactions online due to her food preferences. Fans expressed disappointment after she chose hot dogs over vada pav, leading to a flurry of comments and debates.

Salman Khan's prep Battle of Galwan includes no alcohol and high-altitude trainingSalman Khan is rigorously preparing for his role as a soldier in the film 'Battle of Galwan'. His strict fitness and diet regimen aims to help him perform in the challenging high-altitude terrain of Leh.

Karthi and director Tamizh join hands for Marshal, 1st poster teases retro vibesKarthi's next film with 'Taanakkaran' director Tamizh, has been titled 'Marshal'. The project was officially launched on July 10 with a title poster that teases a coastal, retro setting.

Not my shadow, my legacy: Priyanka Chopra's emotional post about daughter MaltiPriyanka Chopra shared a heartfelt post about her daughter Malti Marie, expressing how she carries the strength and legacy of her mother. Priyanka got married to singer Nick Jonas in 2018 and welcomed Malti through surrogacy in January 2022.

Parag Tyagi says she and wife Shefali Jariwala are together forever in touching postParag Tyagi shared a clip remembering his wife, Shefali Jariwala. He remembered the late actor in the post titled 'Together Forever'.

Mohit Suri: I was very upset when Awarapan didn't do well | ExclusiveMohit Suri, in an exclusive chat, shared that he was disappointed with Awarapan's poor box office performance. Fans have been asking for a re-release of the film.

It wasn't always like this: Rajkummar Rao on dealing with public gaze, pap cultureActor Rajkummar Rao remains a private individual amidst growing fame, choosing to keep his personal life away from the public eye while appreciating the media's respectful approach. He finds solace in genuine connections and the freedom of acting, with exciting projects like 'Maalik' and a new chapter in his personal life on the horizon.

Why Kyunki Saas… after 25 years? Ekta Kapoor explains relaunch in long postEkta Kapoor asks the audience and fans of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' to trust her and the team of the show. She shared a big note explaining why she decided to bring back the show after 25 years despite its huge legacy that is feared to be ruined.

Former NCT member Taeil sentenced to 3.5 years in prison for sexual assaultFormer NCT member Taeil was sentenced to three-and-a-half years for aggravated sexual assault involving a foreign victim. The case raises concerns about exploitation and legal consequences for celebrities in South Korea.

Sudhanshu Pandey vs Apoorva Mukhija gets messy, actor slams her for delulu dramaSudhanshu Pandey hit back at influencer Apoorva Mukhija after their fallout on 'The Traitors', calling her someone who "thrives on drama" and "clickbait." Without naming her, he accused her of milking their on-screen spat for relevance.

In Anurag Basu's Metro... In Dino, feminism looks like everyday womenMetro In Dino feminism is distinct, beautiful and relevant. Anurag Basu designs characters who choose themselves, break conventions and decide to make mistakes of their own kind. Sara Ali Khan, Neena Gupta, Konkona Sensharma, Fatima Sana Shaikh and even the teenage girl - all seem relatable and quietly powerful.

Kajol's one tip to star kids: Unlearn and reinventActor Kajol recently expressed her views on the do-or-die situation for star kids. She also reflected on the trolling and the way forward for young actors in the present scenario.

Rasha Thadani congratulates Shanaya Kapoor after her debut film premiereRasha Thadani extended her support to Shanaya Kapoor at the premiere of 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan'. She greeted the debutante with a warm hug and praised her performance.

general news.headline: Why connect voter roll revision to Bihar polls: Supreme Court raps election bodyHearing a clutch of petitions challenging the Election Commission's decision, the Supreme Court said the poll watchdog had a mandate under the Constitution to conduct the exercise.

Bird becoming parrot: Congress MP's veiled dig at Shashi Thaoor's Emergency op-edShashi Tharoor, in an opinion piece published in the Malayalam daily Deepika, argued that the Emergency should not be remembered solely as a dark chapter in India's history but that its complexities and lessons must be fully understood.

Siddaramaiah shuts leadership change buzz: Seat not empty, here for 5 yearsAmid swirling speculation over a leadership change in Karnataka, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah told India Today TV he will remain in office for a full five-year term and lead Congress into 2028 polls.

3 things to answer: What top court told poll body on Bihar voter rolls revisionThe Supreme Court is hearing a batch of petitions challenging the Election Commission's electoral roll revision in Bihar. The bench noted the practicality of the move, but questioned the timing a few months before the assembly elections.

South Indians run dance bars...: Sena MLA's fresh slur after viral assault videoSanjay Gaikwad, a two-term legislator from Buldhana, was caught on video slapping and punching a canteen contractor at the Akashwani MLA residence in Mumbai for allegedly serving stale food.
Earthquake jolts Delhi-NCR: Decoding what lies beneath the capitalThe seismic activity in Delhi-NCR is caused not only by distant Himalayan tectonics but also by local geological structures.

Superman review: James Gunn brings the fun back to David Corenswet-led DC heroRelease Date:Fri Jul 11, 2025Superman movie review: James Gunn's new 'Superman' film revives the superhero with a perfect mix of humour and heart, focusing on identity and hope. Featuring David Corenswet and Rachel Brosnahan, the film is a vibrant, feel-good tribute to the Man of Steel.

Job applicant's hilarious half-printed resume says 'Hire me to unlock full potential'A Reddit post on the popular subreddit r/recruitinghell with the title, "Resume printed halfway and said: 'Hire me to unlock full potential', has gone viral.

Truck swallowed by caved-in road in Gurugram after heavy rainA shocking incident of civic apathy has occurred in Gurugram, part of the National Capital Region. After hours of heavy rainfall, a road caved in, swallowing an entire truck. The accident speaks volumes about the crumbling infrastructure in the area. The incident took place on a service road near the SPR road, where the truck driver, Satpal, was making a left turn. The road suddenly gave way, causing the back of the truck to sink. Eyewitnesses report that the ground beneath appeared hollow, with water continuously flowing underneath. The collapse happened swiftly, leaving no time for reaction. Fortunately, the driver and his associate managed to escape unharmed. The area has now been cordoned off and traffic diverted. This incident highlights the poor construction quality and infrastructure issues plaguing the region, especially during monsoons.

Man arrested for filming women on Bengaluru streets, posting videos without consentA woman called out an Instagram account for secretly filming women in popular areas in Bengaluru without consent and posting them online. After her video went viral, police arrested 26-year-old Gurudeep Singh for posting the reels and harassing women.

Raj Thackeray and Shrinkhal Chaliha are just two of the extremists preventing decades-old wounds from healing through toxic politics that goes against the modern Indian concept of staying anywhere in India for education, business or leisure.

Girls stripped for period check after blood stains found in school washroomAfter spotting drops of blood in the school bathroom, the principal summoned girls from Classes 5 to 10 to the school hall for a strip-check.

Lover mixes abortion pills in dessert, woman loses pregnancy in PuneA Pune woman was allegedly drugged and forced into an abortion by her lover, who secretly mixed an abortion pill into a sweet dish, rabadi. The accused, Adarsh Valmik Meshram, is currently in police custody.

Rahul Mishra blends sufism, art and Indian heritage for Paris couture showFor his Fall/Winter 2026 showcase at Paris Haute Couture Week, designer Rahul Mishra did what he does best - blending art and fashion with a generous dose of sculptural accents.

sports.headline: 3rd Test, Day 1 Live Updates: India eye crucial lead at Lord'sIndia (IND) vs England (ENG), 3rd Test, Day 1 Live Updates: Having levelled the five-match Test series with a comprehensive win at Edgbaston, India will look to take a crucial lead when they face England in the third Test at Lord's on Thursday. Jofra Archer has been named in England's Test XI after more than four years for the third match of the series at Lord's, starting Thursday. Jasprit Bumrah will also return to India's playing XI after being rested for the second Test.

Lord's Test: Jofra Archer tipped to make Pat Cummins-esque returnEngland vs India: Steve Harmison has tipped Jofra Archer to make a Pat Cummins-esque return to Test cricket after being back in the England red-ball lineup for the first time in 4 years. Archer will play in the Lord's Test against India.

IPL ticket scam: CID arrests Hyderabad cricket chief Jagan Mohan Rao, 4 othersThe Crime Investigation Department (CID) on Wednesday arrested Hyderabad Cricket Association (HCA) President A. Jagan Mohan Rao in connection with a ticketing scandal during the 2025 Indian Premier League (IPL) season.

How Sunil Gavaskar escaped becoming a good fisherman and bad batsmanSunil Gavaskar was mistakenly swapped with another baby at birth in the hospital. His uncle noticed the missing birthmark on his ear and alerted the family just in time. Had his uncle not noticed, Gavaskar might have grown up a good fisherman and a bad batsman.

Dukes ball drama and Lord's slope: ENG vs IND 3rd Test buzz explainedEngland vs India, 3rd Test: The Dukes ball has come under scrutiny in the ENG vs IND series for going soft and losing shape too quickly, frustrating bowlers and prompting calls for change. Karun Nair eyes redemption at Lord's as 2nd chance at cricket nears expiry dateHaving earned a second chance at international cricket, Karun Nair now finds himself at a crucial juncture after failing to convert his starts into big scores in the first two Tests. Another poor performance at Lord's could very well spell the end of the road for the Vidarbha batter, especially with several talented youngsters waiting in the wings.

Italy on cusp of historic T20 World Cup spot after stunning ScotlandItaly defeated Scotland by 12 runs on Wednesday and are on the verge of making their way through to the Men's T20 World Cup to be held next year.

Wimbledon: Not pain free, but Jannik Sinner breezes past Ben Shelton into semisJannik Sinner fought through pain to make it to the semi-finals of Wimbledon 2025 by beating Ben Shelton in straight sets on Wednesday, July 9. Sinner breezed past Shelton in two hours and 19 minutes on Wednesday.

Real Madrid vs PSG, FIFA Club World Cup semi-final: Where to watch in IndiaReal Madrid take on PSG in a blockbuster Club World Cup semi-final, where Kylian Mbappe faces his former club. With Chelsea waiting in the final, it's all to play for at MetLife.

Lyon saved from Ligue 1 relegation, but Crystal Palace suffer blow to Europe hopesLyon has been saved from Ligue 1 relegation as their appeal to overturn the decision was made on Wednesday, July 9. However, this has put Crystal Palace's participation in the Europa League under doubt as both clubs belong to the same owners.

Mom last year, Wimbledon semis this year: Belinda Bencic continues magical runWimbledon 2025: Belinda Bencic, 28, has reached the semi-finals of the grass-court Grand Slam for the first time in her career. Lord's Test, India's playing XI: Bumrah returns, but will Arshdeep also play?With Jasprit Bumrah all set to make his return to the playing XI for the Lord's Test, it will be interesting to see if India will be tempted to add a fourth pacer to their lineup. This opens the door for Arshdeep Singh to make his debut in Tests.

Did India force England to change Lord's pitch plan? Rishabh Pant reactsRishabh Pant said that the Indian team isn't thinking about England are planning with the Lord's pitch ahead of the third Test, which begins from July 10. A lot of talk has been about the Lord's pitch, which seemed to be on the greener side as compared to the tracks for the first two Tests.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
